lines.text: What makes her talk like that - you and she? I do not believe it is born in you! I do not believe it!
It's not born in you - it happens after you're born!

[giving a shrunken head to Lt. Cable]
You like I give you, free!
Free? You never gave me anything free!

[the ancient Mary is looking him up and down]
Lieu-tellen, you sexy man.
Thanks... You're looking pretty... er, fit yourself.

[Cable has been told that Nellie is in love with Emile]
That's hard to believe, sir; they tell me he's a middle-aged man.

[fuming]
Cable, it is a common mistake for boys of your age and athletic ability to underestimate men who have reached their maturity. Young women frequently find older men attractive, strange as it may seem. I myself am over fifty. I am a bachelor. And Cable, I do not, by any means, consider myself th-r-rough.
[to Harbison, who is trying not to laugh]
You gotta do something to break the monotony out here, Lieutenant. You know, if this war ever really gets started ...

[as if he knew something that Buzz Adams does not]
It'll get started.

[taken by surprise]
Sure - sure, it'll get started.
When all you care about is here, this is a good place to be.

[referring to racial prejudice]
This is something that's born in me!
